title: 1976 Triumph TR6

description: Now featured in our Milwaukee showroom is this 1973 Triumph TR6 that has underwent a full frame off restoration. The car is believed to have just over 90,000 miles on it since it was new but it only has 600 miles on it since it was fully restored! This car was stripped down to its bare body and underwent many hours of hard labor to get it just right. Once it was prepped , the underside was sprayed in a undercoating to protect it from rust, and the top-side was shot a Fire Mist Red to really make this car pop. When putting the brakes back on this car, nearly every component of the braking system was replaced or rebuilt including all of the brake lines running throughout the car which was filled with DOT 5. The engine also went through an overhaul which included replacing the time chain, camshaft gear, crankshaft gear, and all of the seals. The starter was rebuilt, a new fuel pump was installed, and the temperature and oil pressure sensors were replaced. Once the rebuild was completed, each cylinder had a compression test done and was on spec. The engine was then hooked up to the transmission which underwent the same treatment which included replacing the pressure plate, disc, throw out bearing, pilot bearing, and all of the seals. The engine and transmission were then dropped back in the car and filled and hooked up to the differential which had also been gone through.  The car was then set back on the ground on a set of red line tires. After the car was professionally aligned and carburetors tuned, it was ready to hit those curvy back roads and cruise. The hard work that has gone into this car really shows when you get behind the wheel and start to drive. The suspension and steering feels tight and does not lack in power. This car is a great choice for someone who has always wanted a British two-seater that they can just jump in and take for a cruise on those nice sunny days. This vehicle is located in our Milwaukee showroom. You can view this 1973 Triumph TR6 in greater detail including HD pictures and an HD video of it running and driving at Gatewayclassiccars.com. If you are interested in purchasing this vehicle or have more questions regarding it please call us at (262)-891-4253 or email us at Milwaukee@gatewayclassiccars.com.

description: Featured in Our Orlando Florida Showroom is this  1972 Triumph TR6 Ã¢??People should drive cars. Cars shouldnÃ¢??t drive people.Ã¢?Â This was one of TriumphÃ¢??s advertising slogans for the TR6 and seems to be sage words of advice that seems to have been lost over the years. With cars becoming more practical and losing all of their character, the TR6 will not just break the mold, but turn it into dust. The classic British roadster styling matched with the powerful 2.5L I-6 hooked up to a 4-speed manual transmission and overdrive, you can tear up the roads with style and ease. The independent front suspension makes for a smooth ride and superior handling. This Triumph TR6 garage kept and well maintained throughout its life. When you get it in this roadster and turn the key, it fires up every time. As you put it in gear and release the clutch, the car will leave the line without hesitation and as you shift through the gears you will be pleasantly surprised by the amount of pep that comes from such a small car. As you are cruising along you can utilize the working overdrive to keep the engine from winding too high and putting unnecessary strain on the components. This car was also fitted with an aftermarket AM FM CD player so you can put on your favorite playlist while you sail down the open road. Another one of TriumphÃ¢??s slogans they used for these cars was, Ã¢??The new Triumph TR6. The racing car with a difference. You can afford it.Ã¢?Â This vehicle is located in our Orlando Florida  showroom. You can view this 1972 Triumph TR6 in greater detail including HD pictures and an HD video of it running and driving at Gatewayclassiccars.com. If you are interested in purchasing this vehicle or have more questions regarding it please call us at 407-771-2000 or email us at Orlando@gatewayclassiccars.com. - See more at: http://www.gatewayclassiccars.com/orlando/1972/triumph/tr6-S729.html

This TR-6 Roadster has been repainted in a stunning red paint job roughly just over 7 years ago and glistens like it was done yesterday. This TR-6 is fairly original and has been extremely well cared for over the years. The classic roadster runs, drives, sounds and looks great! description: The Triumph TR6 was a best-selling British sports car built between 1968 and 1976. It has long been the favorite of British sports car aficionados around the world thanks to its good looks, great handling and solid performance. The number of car clubs dedicated to the car attest to its popularity.     This 1969 Triumph TR6 represents the breed especially well. Looking great in green and black, it draws attention without shouting. The engine moves the car with alacrity, humming smoothly under the hood and transferring power to the wheels through a well-matched four speed manual transmission. This is a driving machine, and the whole experience of the car reinforces that impression.     If you're the previous owner of a TR6, and rue the day you sold the car, this is your chance to turn back time. Live those top-down glory days once again. For those of you who have never yet owned a TR6, this is your chance to join the club--literally. You will enjoy the car itself, of course, but you might be surprised at how much you also enjoy the camaraderie of fellow British sports car enthusiasts. It's like a family, and you'll be warmly welcomed.    Don't just stand there on the outside looking in! Call Art & Speed today at (901) 850-0507. We'd love to introduce you to some friends.

title: 1970 Triumph TR6

description: This '75 TR6 was driven and cared for by one owner for all but the last two years. Essentially a survivor, the car has not been restored in the sense of a complete overhaul, but it has been updated and given a makeover.     The car has new seat covers, new carpet, new floor mats, new dash knobs, new windshield glass, a new vinyl top, new tires, new leather-wrapped steering wheel, and new paint. Paint was flaking in two spots on the hood and rear deck. Localized fixes would have contrasted with adjacent panels, so we refreshed the whole car. We spruced up the engine bay as well, and used correct and original parts, including, for example, green rubber hoses.     The transmission is a rebuild, but the car also comes with the original transmission if the buyer prized originality. Many other parts are included with the car as well as the original factory partial tonneau for the back, and the full tonneau that covers the entire passenger compartment.     The principal owner of the car drove it frequently, and that's all the car needs now - someone to drive it. Call Art & Speed at (901) 850-0507 if you'd like to be the one to make that happen.
Financing

description: Gateway Classic Cars of Tampa is proud to offer this bold 1972 Triumph TR6. This is a great time to buy Triumphs as they are just starting to rise in price, making them a great investment.  These Triumphs are a blast to drive with their 6 cylinder engines and 4 speed manual transmissions, they are truly a drivers car! You are in complete control of all 2,500 pounds! Rated at 104hp at 4,500 rpm and 143-lbs.ft. of torque at 3,000 rpm, these cars have a top speed of 120 MPH! She shows beautifully in Saffron yellow, which is he correct Ã¢??54Ã¢?Â paint code with a black convertible top and code Ã¢??11Ã¢?Â black interior. The seller states this this is original paint on this TR6, which would make it even more collectible and valuable. The TR6 is the predecessor to the TR4 and TR5 and is the best selling of the three. The body changes make the car seem larger and more square and appealed to most audiences more than the prior TRs. Options include manual convertible top, vinyl seats, seat belts, Alpine Am/Fm/Cassette player, radial tires and rally wheels. Don't miss your shot at a fun little cruiser that is ready to show and go! Located in our Tampa Showroom, this 72 TR6 can be seen in greater detail including HD pictures and video at www.GatewayClassicCars.com. For immediate assistance please call 813-645-6200 or email Tampa@GatewayClassicCars.com.
title: 1972 Triumph TR6

description: Gateway Classic Cars of Tampa is proud to offer this stunning 1975 Triumph TR6. This is a 54,696 actual mile example with a British Motor Industry Heritage Trust; Certified Copy of a Factory Record! The record shows that is was built on August 26, 1975 and sent to British Leyland Motors Inc, of Galveston Texas. The car was shipped from the Newport South Dock aboard the vessel Ã¢??Madame Butterfly".  It documents that it is an original Ã¢??JavaÃ¢?Â green car with black interior and black top. The engine number, chassis number, and gives all technical data for the drivetrain. Options on this TR6 include manual convertible top, vinyl interior, seat belts, radial tires, aluminum alloy wheels, and one of the most popular colors available.  These cars are quick, fun, economic, and increasing in value. These are great collector pieces and now is the time to buy! The inline 6 cylinders are peppy with the two sidedraught Stromberg carburetors, and is mated to a 4 speed manual that keeps you in control. With 3.70 gears and and at just under 2,500 pounds these cars are a joy to drive! The top speed is 120 MPH on these and you will enjoy every second of getting there. Don't miss out on this sporty cruiser.  Located in our Tampa Showroom, this 1975 Triumph TR6 can be seen in greater detail including HD pictures and Video at www.GatewayClassicCars.com. For immediate assistance please call 813-645-6200 or email Tampa@GatewayClassicCars.com
title: 1975 Triumph TR6

description: For sale in our Dallas showroom is a British classic. Produced from 1968-1976, the TR6 was the best best-seller of the TR range built by Triumph when production ended in July 1976. Of the 94,416 TR6s produced over that span, 86,249 were exported out of the United Kingdom. Most have since found their final resting places, but one found its way to our Dallas showroom. This 1973 TR6 is believed to have 86,000 much loved miles and has received quite a lot of care during its life. Most recently the SU carburetors, brake pads, distributor and spark plug wires, a new clutch slave cylinder and new tires. It is hard to beat the sound of the Triumph inline six at full chat, I mean just listen to it. Overall condition is good and we consider this a great driver quality car. The features include AM/FM Radio, Cassette, Manual Convertible Top, Seat Belts, Leather Interior, and Radial Tires. For more HD pictures and video visit http://www.gatewayclassiccars.com/carlist2?src=2&location=DFW&desc=Dallas. For more information call our Dallas showroom at 817-310-9400.
